message: TweetHit consumes Twitter's Streaming API and finds out the most mentioned products on Amazon. It does not represent the real number of mentions as there're lots of spam bots polluting the platform.
the select product group thing could use a down arrow
@italiano40 Well streaming API does not feed you the same tweets over and over, does it?
and it should have hover effects on left, right, and product group
@italiano40 Yeah you're spot on about product group menu, but showing the tweet contents may be a problem as I don't store any of those.
thanks @Znt!
also it should be a shorter list or have two columns
meh

it is a ok web app, you need to fix the select product group combo box since it blends into the background and that doesn't look good, also maybe show, what the people are saying since if it mention it could be good or bad
...and maybe a tooltip to indicate that the arrows are for changing the day
@Znt so you just add to the count? because you should store a URL or something just to make sure your not counting the same tweets over and over just as a check
@Znt i haven't really taken a look into the twitter API, but it always good to have a check in place and to think long term of where the project may go
you can check the full source code at github: https://github.com/ocanbascil/TweetHit
Here's the key list for Streaming API search: amazon,amzn,asin,isbn,book http,game http,deal http,livre http,jeu http,dvd http,spiel http,buch http,faire http
I'm using Tweepy library for Twitter connection: https://github.com/joshthecoder/tweepy

@italiano40 Here's how it works basically. My laptop connects to Streaming API and starts receiving tweets. It then extracts URLs from each tweet and sends them to the app by doing a simple http post. The webapp then fetches the URLs and finds out if they point to a valid Amazon Product page.

i was about to recommend google app engine, also you should be able to put the streaming api on app engine so you don't need your laptop on to get the tweets, also since you are using app engine i know it cost money, so i understand less data, but i really feel if you are into this project your going to need to store the tweets some how b/c they could be neg. or pos. and stuff like that LOL
also what are you using to gather this info? is it a python or java scrapper?
what are you searching for? amzn.to and amazon.com ? or just one of the two?

@italiano40 I am really not sure how to implement Streaming API on App Engine as it does not allow you to have long lived connections (maximum is 10 mins I think). Normally when I open a connection it lives for about a day until I restart it.
@Znt well does twitter have a push streaming API I thought they did well then I guess you can't use that
